title: Sheet Pan Roasted Vegetables Recipe
description: Your favorite vegetables such as zucchini, eggplant, carrots, tomatoes, bell peppers and onions roasted in olive oil with herbs, garlic and lemon.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Vegetables Roasted Vegetable Recipes Sheet Pan Roasted Vegetables 4.4 (165) 122 Reviews 14 Photos Succulent roasted vegetables with a sweet and smoky, herby taste. Good for a main course with noodles or rice, or as a side dish. Submitted by JRCROSBY31 Updated on November 19, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 14 14 14 14 Prep Time: 30 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 30 mins Total Time: 2 hrs Servings: 24 Yield: 24 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 24 servings 8 zucchini, peeled and chopped 1 eggplant, peeled and diced 8 carrots, diced 16 cherry tomatoes 2 red onions, sliced 1 red bell pepper, sliced 1 yellow bell pepper, sliced ½ cup olive oil 1 teaspoon dried rosemary 1 teaspoon dried thyme 2 bay leaves, crushed 1 teaspoon dried oregano 2 cloves garlic, minced 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice 1 teaspoon grated lemon zest salt and pepper to taste Directions In a large bowl mix the zucchini, eggplant, carrots, tomatoes, onions and peppers with the oil, rosemary, thyme, bay leaves, oregano, garlic, lemon juice, lemon zest, salt and pepper. Cover and chill for at least 2 hours, and preferably overnight. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). On a large roasting pan, roast the vegetables, uncovered, for 20 minutes, or until the tomatoes have split and the edges of some of the vegetables are starting to crisp. Remove from the oven and stir before returning to the oven for another 20 minutes. At this time reduce heat to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C) and continue cooking until vegetables are tender, turning every 20 minutes. I Made It Print 302 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 72 Calories 5g Fat 7g Carbs 2g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 24 Calories 72 % Daily Value * Total Fat 5g 6% Saturated Fat 1g 4% Sodium 11mg 0% Total Carbohydrate 7g 3% Dietary Fiber 2g 8% Total Sugars 4g Protein 2g 3% Vitamin C 28mg 31% Calcium 23mg 2% Iron 1mg 4% Potassium 326mg 7% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Sheet Pan Roasted Vegetables 01 of 14 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 14 Photo by  jtcooks77 12/24/2021 This was great - I made it in winter and added a wonderful brightness to my meal. I love how easy this recipe is, and the lemon juice and zest added so much, along with the mix of herbs. It's very flexible too - can use whatever veggies you have on hand, and it will be delicious. Will definitely make this again! 03 of 14 Photo by  Elizabeth 12/22/2021 I’ve made this a couple of times and I usually just use what veggies I have on hand. I don’t find it necessary to marinate the veggies overnight. I like to add some chicken to mine and then I portion it out for lunches for the week. I also prefer to use fresh herbs, but I like it either way. 04 of 14 Photo by  Elizabeth 12/22/2021 I’ve made this a couple of times and I usually just use what veggies I have on hand. I don’t find it necessary to marinate the veggies overnight. I like to add some chicken to mine and then I portion it out for lunches for the week. I also prefer to use fresh herbs, but I like it either way. 05 of 14 Photo by  Kezia Kezia 02/21/2021 Great! 06 of 14 Photo by  Tee 12/30/2019 07 of 14 Photo by  missyk 06/15/2017 08 of 14 Photo by  Canned Heat 08/27/2016 This is probably my favorite roasted veg I've made. I think the lemon zest and the seasonings are key. Everything single thing in this blend came out of our garden outside of the oil and dry seasonings. 09 of 14 Photo by  puppypen 10/07/2014 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Garlic Loves Roasted Cabbage 30 Ratings Simple Sheet Pan Ratatouille 7 Ratings Tasty Roasted Beets 115 Ratings Roasted Autumn Root Vegetables 25 Ratings Roasted Eggplant and Mushrooms 55 Ratings Roasted Eggplant 168 Ratings Roasted Romanesco 47 Ratings Summer Vegetable Ratatouille 164 Ratings Roasted Cabbage Wedges 7 Ratings Rosemary Roasted Butternut Squash 154 Ratings Easy Roasted Cabbage 28 Ratings Marinated Barbequed Vegetables 101 Ratings Roasted Apples and Brussels Sprouts 186 Ratings Zucchini Saute 182 Ratings Sweet and Spicy Roasted Cabbage Wedges 2 Ratings Roasted Radishes 48 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: JRCROSBY31
instructions: In a large bowl mix the zucchini, eggplant, carrots, tomatoes, onions and peppers with the oil, rosemary, thyme, bay leaves, oregano, garlic, lemon juice, lemon zest, salt and pepper. Cover and chill for at least 2 hours, and preferably overnight.;Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).;On a large roasting pan, roast the vegetables, uncovered, for 20 minutes, or until the tomatoes have split and the edges of some of the vegetables are starting to crisp. Remove from the oven and stir before returning to the oven for another 20 minutes. At this time reduce heat to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C) and continue cooking until vegetables are tender, turning every 20 minutes.
